title: Calories in a Ribeye Steak
meta_description: Learn calories in a ribeye steak (typical 250g serving), plus protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition details for easy tracking.
assumptions: Boneless ribeye steak, broiled or grilled, moderate marbling; typical serving 250 g cooked weight, no added sauces or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut size, fat content, cooking method, and trimming; check labels or use a scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A typical 250 g ribeye steak provides ~678 kcal and ~60 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Bone-in (effective meat weight reduced to 200 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in a ribeye steak?
faqs.a: About 678 kcal for a typical 250 g cooked boneless ribeye steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 60 g protein in a 250 g serving.
No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”it's primarily protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in ribeye steak?
faqs.a: Broiling or grilling keeps it similar; frying or adding butter increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: Is ribeye high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 20 g saturated fat in a 250 g steak due to marbling.
